Indian Economy.title: Statistical paradoxes in a fast growing economy
Indian Economy.summary: India’s GDP data continue to veer into irrelevance for most economic agents, who are behaving very differently from what robust growth would dictate

Indian Economy.title: The Indian economy’s 8.2% second-quarter growth: Can it expand at such a brisk pace for years to come?

Indian Economy.title: The IMF’s critique of India’s economic statistics is not a cause for alarm but a cue to improve data quality
Indian Economy.summary: The Fund awarded India a ‘C’ grade in its assessment of our macro data quality. Its criticism of our estimates is best taken as a cue to further improve the country’s statistical framework. Thankfully, remedial work has already begun.

Indian Economy.title: December to see positive start for Indian markets
Indian Economy.summary: December begins with positive momentum for Indian markets, driven by strong GDP growth and optimistic investor sentiment.

Startups & Funding.title: Bigger cheques, fewer deals: What’s driving India’s startup revival?
Startups & Funding.summary: Deal value is on the mend as well, and that's despite lower volumes. While 2024 saw early-stage startups raise $1.5 billion across 513 deals, this year so far has seen 432 deals with companies raising a total of $1.6 billion.

Startups & Funding.title: Amazon of renewables for farmers AgriVijay to expand to Mauritius, UAE and Kenya
Startups & Funding.summary: AgriVijay plans to expand its renewable energy services for farmers to Mauritius, UAE, and Kenya, launching innovative solar solutions.

Startups & Funding.title: OpenAI acquires stake in Thrive Holdings, seeks to boost AI adoption in business services
Startups & Funding.summary: OpenAI plans to acquire a stake in Thrive Holdings to promote AI adoption in businesses, focusing on accounting and IT services.

Banking & Finance.summary: Students registered under the International Division can also apply online using the payment options available in their region. They are required to follow the same steps as domestic learners.

Banking & Finance.summary: RBI Deputy Governor Swaminathan urges banks to balance T20-style innovation with Test-match discipline, stressing risk culture, customer trust and cyber resilience.
